context: [1] In earlier work, we found that high emission rates of isoprene were correlated with low chloroplastic pools of DMAPP . [2] This indicates that the set point for DMAPP concentration may be different in different plants and would require very large variations in the amount of isoprene synthase in leaves. [3] Both the substrate concentration inside chloroplasts and the amount of isoprene synthase  have effects on the rate of isoprene emission. [4] In future work, we plan to measure DMAPP concentration and isoprene synthase amount and activity in response to changes known to influence isoprene emission rates, including development (; ) and weather (; ; ). [1] Leaves were taken from a Eucalyptus globulus tree kept in a greenhouse of the Institute of Plant Pathology at the University of Bonn. [2] During summer, the tree stood outside in the garden of the institute. [3] Leaves were cut under water and held in water for the whole measurements.
